climbs.name: Bad Apple
climbs.fa: Drew Leiterman, Lee Leiterman, Noah Beek. May 2022

content.description:
On the right side of the wall climb good features and ramps to access the obvious open book corner system. Climb through the corner and continue to the top. Celebrate then walk off climbers right.

P1. 5.8. Climbs straight up on some steeper but juggy rock.

P2. 5.8. Traverse right and up to the bottom of the corner, tricky at the end.

P3. 5.9. Stem and layback the open book corner system. Good stuff!

P4. 5.6. Take the slabs to the top!

Pitches could be linked with a 70m rope and some runners.

Rappeling after the second pitch could be difficult due the the traversing on said pitch.

Great warm up to the area! While still getting to touch this absolutely unique rock outcrop that Noah Beek found a few years back.



Right side of the cliff. 

10 quickdraws. More if your linking pitches.

Route right of W.E. is a closed project


a couple parmadraws here and there

This route wanders up the left side of POV. Fun, dusty and exposed. A clip-up by P.O.V standards.

Pitch 1: 5.10c A bit of a harsh warmup. Climb steep rock for 5 bolts to a ledge. Unprotected 3rd class to another steep section. Continue up and left to anchor. This pitch suffers from a bit of rope drag. Use your alpine draws wisely.

Pitch 2: 5.10a Up the middle of the face to a spacious ledge and a high anchor.

Pitch 3: 5.10b Escape off the ledge left via steep move.  Continue up easy ground to a very exposed corner system. Half way up the corner is a very hard to read crux than an anchor. Escape left (be careful) and walk down Bad Apples decent.



Left side of POV

Bring 13 draws. 3-4 should be alpine.

The right most route off the Party ledge. Pull a roof on positive holds then climb easy terrain up and right. Fun moves lead to a wicked but hard-to-read crux. Continue up wildly exposed jugs to a redpoint crux mantle. Feel the pump! Chill on the small ledge and enjoy the view. 3 more draws of slightly dusty 5.11. 70m rope. Lower till level with belay. Belayer throws rest of rope to climber. Pull yourself to belay



Climb Glitter to party ledge. Right most route off party ledge

12 parmadraws

The first route to be climbed at P.O.V. More of an approach pitch to the party ledge for Yellow Mellow overhang. Located in the middle of the wall under the big prow.

Climb hard and slightly awkward moves for 3 bolts. A bit of unprotected 3rd class takes you to a steepish wall. Climb it (crux) to a ledge. Easier climbing to another ledge with an intermediate anchor. Climbing left or right (harder) of the bolts to a final crux pulling onto the party ledge.



15 bolts. 4 of them permadraws. Bring a couple alpine. Rap twice or bring an 80m

Left most route off the party ledge. Climb easy rock to 2 very steep sections separate by a good rest. Each has its own crux. Suuuuper pumpy. 70m rope. Lower till level with belay then throw remaining rope to climber. Pull yourself to the belay.



Climb Glitter to party ledge. Left most route.

11 or 12 permadraws

I would give this route 5 stars if I could haha. More of a variation of YM. Instead of cutting left after the 2 long chain draws continue straight up on jugs and past a crux traversing left back into YMs rest. Finish up the prow of YM. 70m rope. Lower till level with belay. Belayer throws remaining rope to climber. Pull yourself to the belay.



Climb Glitter to party ledge

11 parmadraws

Probably the reason you made the hike. No move harder than V3 but soooo pumpy. Climb 3 draws of Hallucination than move up and right to another below a roof. Clip 2 long ass chain draws then cut left. Up steep jugs to a rest under the even steeper prow. The crux comes right before the anchor. 70m rope. Lower till level with belay. Belayer throws the remaining rope to climber. Pull yourself to the ledge.



Climb glitter to party ledge. 2nd from left

11 permadraws

Im not sure how this cliff has gone unnoticed for so long. From the parking lot you can clearly see the potential. POV is Quartzite with big veins of Quartz crystals cutting through all over. Albeit quite chossy in spots but with lots of sections of bullet proof rock. The style is definitely thuggy. The rock is so featured that until routes get more traffic and chalk, its a bit of a find your own adventure which makes for hard onsighting. With a lot of work cleaning and climbing, some of the routes are cleaning up nice. IMO POV has some of the best steep sport climbing in Eastern B.C.
